[File: aptos-core/api/src/state.rs] [Function: raw_table_item()] [Zero-length raw key] Does a zero-length key in RawTableItemRequest at line 200 have defined behavior, or can it access special table entries like headers or metadata? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/api/src/state.rs] [Function: table_item()] [JSON injection in responses] Can move_value at line 461 contain malicious JSON that breaks parsing on the client side, enabling XSS or injection attacks in client applications? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/api/src/state.rs] [Function: get_raw_state_value()] [Experimental API abuse] Does the experimental/hidden endpoint at line 237 have different security requirements than stable APIs, potentially allowing attacks that bypass standard protections? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/api/src/state.rs] [Function: raw_value()] [Direct StateKey access risk] Can get_raw_state_value() enable direct access to internal state keys that should only be accessible through higher-level abstractions, breaking encapsulation? (High)

[File: aptos-core/api/src/state.rs] [Function: resource()] [State-consensus inconsistency] Can resource() return state that hasn't been finalized by consensus yet, causing clients to act on uncommitted state that might be rolled back? (High)
